contextId.occurrenceNote: Here, "willing" and "obedient" are used together to express one idea. Alternate translation: "If you willingly obey" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hendiadys]])
contextId.glQuote: If you are willing and obedient

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "glory" describes "majesty." Alternate translation: "the beauty he has as king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hendiadys]])

Here the word "heat" describes the word "sun." The people suffering from the sun's heat is spoken of as if the heat struck them. Alternate translation: "nor will they suffer from the sun's heat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hendiadys]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: nor will the heat or sun beat on them
